intro: Morna nivea, commonly known as the white morna, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Morna nivea is often found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
